name: 09.13-Deeptools: plotCorrelation
description: Tool for the analysis and visualization of sample correlations based on the output of multiBamSummary or multiBigwigSummary

parameters.name: Input matrix
parameters.description: Compressed matrix of values generated by multiBigwigSummary or multiBamSummary

parameters.name: Method
parameters.description: Correlation method

parameters.name: Output type
parameters.description: Choose between a heatmap or pairwise scatter plots

parameters.name: Output plot
parameters.description: File to save the heatmap to. The file extension determines the format, so heatmap.pdf will save the heatmap in PDF format. The available formats are: .png, .eps, .pdf and .svg

parameters.name: Labels
parameters.description: User defined labels instead of default labels from file names. Multiple labels have to be separated by spaces, e.g. –labels sample1 sample2 sample3

parameters.name: Plot title
parameters.description: Title of the plot, to be printed on top of the generated image. Leave blank for no title

parameters.name: Plot format
parameters.description: Image format type. If given, this option overrides the image format based on the plotFile ending. The available options are: png, eps, pdf and svg

parameters.name: Height
parameters.description: Plot height in cm

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: Plot width in cm

parameters.name: Min. intensities
parameters.description: Minimum value for the heatmap intensities. If not specified, the value is set automatically

parameters.name: Max. intensities
parameters.description: Maximum value for the heatmap intensities. If not specified, the value is set automatically

parameters.name: Color map
parameters.description: Color map to use for the heatmap. Available values can be seen here: http://matplotlib.org/examples/color/colormaps_reference.html

parameters.name: X range
parameters.description: The X axis range. The default scales these such that the full range of dots is displayed

parameters.name: Y range
parameters.description: The Y axis range. The default scales these such that the full range of dots is displayed

parameters.name: Log1p
parameters.description: Plot the natural log of the scatter plot after adding 1. Note that this is ONLY for plotting, the correlation is unaffected

parameters.name: Other parameters
parameters.description: Other parameters

parameters.name: Remove outliers
parameters.description: If set, bins with very large counts are removed. Bins with abnormally high reads counts artificially increase pearson correlation; that’s why, multiBamSummary tries to remove outliers using the median absolute deviation (MAD) method applying a threshold of 200 to only consider extremely large deviations from the median. The ENCODE blacklist page (https://sites.google.com/site/anshulkundaje/projects/blacklists) contains useful information about regions with unusually high countsthat may be worth removing

parameters.name: Skip zeros
parameters.description: By setting this option, genomic regions that have zero or missing (nan) values in all samples are excluded

parameters.name: Output cor. matrix
parameters.description: Save matrix with pairwise correlation values to a tab-separated file

parameters.name: Plot numbers
parameters.description: If set, then the correlation number is plotted on top of the heatmap. This option is only valid when plotting a heatmap

parameters.name: Help
parameters.description: Help
